RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 1 6F Outer turf CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. OUTER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 36 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUSK coaxed from the gate, raced three then two wide in closest aim of the leader, advanced to prompt the pace through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took over command swinging two to three wide at that station, edged clear under a drive kept to task. TONGUE TWISTER broke in at the start and was corrected, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. FABULOUS FOX chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. LU'S REDEMPTION got bumped at the start by HANDLE ON YOU, chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. STARLIGHT DANCER chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was outfinished. SAVING MEMORIES coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. LEARNING TO FLY chased four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued four wide at the head of the stretch, offered no response. LIL' HAYADOIN coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside coming under pressure through the turn, yielded and took the inside route into upper stretch, then weakened in the late stages. BARONESS BOURBON chased five then four wide under coaxing from three furlongs out, angled six wide into upper stretch, made no impact. HANDLE ON YOU broke in at the start bumping LU'S REDEMPTION, chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Lu's Redemption
ENTRY.OWNER: Clear Stars Stable Mitre Box Stable and Big Toe Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 2p 5/16, 5w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio, Michael and Nassau CC Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Lil' Hayadoin
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, under pressure turn, ins 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Dusk
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Barber, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3-2w in aim, prompted turn, up 2-3w upper, edged clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Spruce Lane, Becker, Copper Beech,Empire, PBG, Hidden Broo

ENTRY.NAME: Learning to Fly
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, no response

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, bid, outfinished

ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing and Dalinka Brandon M
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed inside 5/16, 2w 1/4p, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Baroness Bourbon
ENTRY.OWNER: Bourbon Lane Stable (J Hill M McMahon) Begg James Bentley Saratoga Winners Stavr
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Mohawk S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 2 1 1/16M Turf CR: 106. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entrie s. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds, 122 lbs. Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstakes on th e turf in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance on the turf in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer thi
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRIT OF ST LOUIS two to three wide in pursuit, got set down angled three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong from home, dug in gamely to fend off the runner up to the wire. CITY MAN chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the far turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong latching on the leader a sixteenth out, but was ultimately repelled to the finish. JERRY THE NIPPER two to three wide through the first turn, chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking to the two path through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. RUSE established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was collared near the eighth pole, weakened in the late stages. DAKOTA GOLD chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the far turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Dakota Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed inside near 1/4, 3w upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: City Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Searles Peter and Searles Patty
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed ins near 1/4, 4w upper, rallied, repelled

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit of St Louis
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Schermerhorn Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, set down 3w upper, up 1/8, dug in, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Jerry the Nipper
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w 1st turn, chased 3-4w, coaxed 2p 5/16, 4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ruse
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand inside, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, collared 1/8, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Maid of the Mist S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 81. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomi nation; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. Th e purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden, claiming or starter allowed 2 lbs .; all maidens, 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, October 14, 2023 with 17 Original Nominations and 1 Supplement.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY MANE SQUEEZE chased three wide down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn patiently handled, swung three wide into upper stretch bumping BERNIETAKESCHARGE into CALDWELL LUVS GOLD just prior to straightening away, got roused near the three-sixteenths and collared the leader at the eighth, then edged clear under a drive to prevail. CARA'S TIME showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in and was collared at the eighth pole, ran on to secure the place honors. CALDWELL LUVS GOLD four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, got nudged five wide into upper stretch due to pressure from MY MANE SQUEEZE and offered up a mild bid. BERNIETAKESCHARGE coaxed from the gate, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, got bumped by MY MANE SQUEEZE four wide into upper stretch and nudged the aforementioned foe five wide, then weakened in the late stages. VALENTINE GIFT chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, tired and was eased through the final furlong. LIKA ROLLING STONE seven paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked six then five wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung five to six wide into upper stretch, tired, and was eased through the final eighth. KAZ' ROSE chased six then five wide coming under coaxing midway on the turn, angled in four then three wide at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch backing away and was eased home through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Bernietakescharge
ENTRY.OWNER: Rosenthal, Robert D. and Bernstein, Bradford H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, bumped 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: My Mane Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w backstretch, inside turn, bumped foe 3w uppr, up, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Caldwell Luvs Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, nudged 5w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Cara's Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, collared 1/8p, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Valentine Gift
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired, eased final 1/8th

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz' Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 6-5w, angled 4-3w 5/16, 4w upper, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Lika Rolling Stone
ENTRY.OWNER: Valente, Roddy J. and Bilinski, Darlene
ENTRY.COMMENT: 7w backstretch, 6-5w turn, 5-6w upper, tired, eased final 1/8th

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Tim e Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 36 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DISARMED hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and held stubbornly to command to the finish. ZEEBEAR led briefly soon after the start, then chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. FACTUALLY CORRECT chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, ran on to preserve the show honors. RUNNINGWSCISSORS chased just off the inside, got let out angled six wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to the finish. KING MOONRACER chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, kept on to the finish but was outkicked. RADIO RED hustled from the gate, chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung seven wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid but was outkicked. SINFUL DANCER stumbled at the start conceding two lengths to the front, chased along the inside, came under urging tipped three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Gurdon Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand ins, set down 2w 1/4p, dug in, stubborn

ENTRY.NAME: King Moonracer
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed ins 5/16, 3w upper, kept on, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Sinful Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased inside, urged 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Runningwscissors
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, let out angled 6w upper, dug in, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Radio Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 7w upper, bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Zeebear
ENTRY.COMMENT: led briefly, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Factually Correct
ENTRY.OWNER: Cotrone Robert Imperio Michael Gurdon Andrew O Rodriguez Rudy R Gabrielle Farm M
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Empire Distaff S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 5 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $250 each which sh ould accompany the nomination; $1,250 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,250 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,250 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds 122 lbs. Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners of as weepstakes at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake in 2023 or two races at a mile or over other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturr
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KNOW IT ALL AUDREY coaxed from the gate, chased two then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied and was herded out by the leader ICHIBAN as that foe drifted out three paths from the three-sixteenths to near the sixteenth marker, seized command at that station and edged clear to the finish to prevail. ICHIBAN showed the way in hand just off the inside, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under threat and drifted out despite a right handed crop herding out the aforementioned foe three paths from the three-sixteenths to near the sixteenth marker when displaced from command, darted inwards a step spying the tire track of the gate and ran on clear for the place honors. VENTI VALENTINE got bumped between foes who each broke her way at the start, chased three wide through the first turn and then three to four wide down the backstretch, went three then two wide through the far turn coaxed along from the seven-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and ran on to secure the show honors. SWEET MYSTERY broke out at the start bumping VENTI VALENTINE in tandem with TOUGH STREET, raced just off the inside through the first turn and then four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked to the two path through the far turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide for home and offered up a mild bid. SUNSET LOUISE chased three then four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and weakened. APRIL ANTICS coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, swung three wide at the head of the stretch, weakened. TOUGH STREET three then two wide through the first turn, chased four wide coming under coaxing three furlongs out, went eight wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: April Antics
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC SOK Racing and Politano James
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased inside, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, 4w uppr, herded, edged clear

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, coaxed 7/16, angled 5-6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 2p 1st turn, 4-5w backstretch, 7w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Venti Valentine
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable and Parkland Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped betw st, chased 3-4w, 3-2w turn, 4w upper, ran on

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, 3-2w 1st turn, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 8w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ichiban
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, herded foe, caught 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Ticonderoga S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 94. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMANDA'S FOLLY chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch in closest aim of the leader, tucked three wide and advanced on the front coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, got floated seven wide into upper stretch as SILVER SKILLET went six wide, dug in under a drive and was up in the final jumps to prevail. SILVER SKILLET showed the way in hand four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under pressure near the quarter pole, swung six wide into upper stretch floating her main danger seven wide, got roused straightened away and dug in under threat to the outside through the stretch and was caught in the final jumps to the wire. SWEETIE got brushed at the start by SARATOGA CHROME who broke outwards, chased six then four wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled in to spin just off the inside into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors well clear of the rest. ITSAKEYPER chased five then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, went seven to eight wide into upper stretch, tired. SARATOGA CHROME broke out at the start brushing SWEETIE, chased three then two wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, went six wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Saratoga Chrome
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell David E and Powers Sandra
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetie
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, chased 6-4w, coaxed 7/16, angled 2w 1/4p, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Itsakeyper
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-3w, coaxed 5/16, 7-8w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Skillet
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing Tango Uniform Racing LLC and Rocco Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 4-2w, 6w uppr, roused str away, dug in, caught last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda's Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w backstretch, advanced 3w turn, floated 7w upper, up last jumps

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Iroquois S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 98. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which sh ould accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closi ng of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds, 122 lbs. Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners of a sweep stake in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, October 14, 2023 with 16 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STERLING SILVER four wide in pursuit, came under coaxing angled seven wide into upper stretch, rallied to engage the leader inside the final furlong under a light drive, got bumped when taking command in the final strides to the finish and was up to prevail. LEELOO coaxed from the gate, dueled from the three path early on with BANK ON ANNA to her inside, shook off that rival seven-sixteenths from home and widened a bit before swinging six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive under growing threat to the outside, came out and bumped her main danger as that rival took over in the final jumps while well clear for the place honors. CAPTAINSDAUGHTER coaxed from the start, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, weakened. CAIRO SUGAR coaxed from the gate, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled six wide for home, weakened in the stretch. FUNNY HOW chased just off the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, weakened. VALLELUJAH chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three to four wide for home, tired. BANK ON ANNA coaxed from the gate, dueled inside of LEELOO from the get go while along the inside, got shaken off at the seven-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch in retreat and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Captainsdaughter
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vallelujah
ENTRY.OWNER: East Ave Racing Stable and Sisu Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bank On Anna
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled inside, shaken off 7/16, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club and Cutair Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 7w upper, light drive, bumped late, up

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Sugar
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Leeloo
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 3p early, shook away turn, 6w uppr, caught

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sleepy Hollow S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 92. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden, claiming or starter allowed 2 lbs.; allma idens allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, October 14, 2023 with 17 Original Nominations and 1 Supplement.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL GRANDE O dueled from the three path with SOLO'S FURY to his outside, shook off that rival into the turn and slipped away, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in and held safe to prevail. B D SAINTS got checked at the start when SOLO'S FURY shied outwards taking over the lane, conceded six to seven lengths to the front before being able to settle into stride, chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, offered up a good finish to secure the place honors while well clear of the rest. AGGELOS THE GREAT chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then along the inside through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled four then three wide into upper stretch, kept on to preserve the show honors. WINE RESPONSIBLY chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coaxed along from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals. MISCHIEF JOKE chased five then four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. TWO'S A CROWD six paths off the inside in pursuit down the backstretch, tucked four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued four wide into upper stretch and weakened. BONNE CHANCE chased along the inside and then just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths and tired. SKYLER'S STARSHIP broke out at the start, chased four then two wide coming under coaxing midway on the turn, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and faltered. SOLO'S FURY shied out at the start from the aforementioned foe breaking outwards and forced B D SAINTS to check off his heels, showed the way early on five paths off the inside before being engaged in a duel with EL GRANDE O, got shaken off by that rival and tucked three wide through the turn giving chase, faded and went four wide into upper stretch, gave way and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: El Grande O
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3p, shook away 2p turn, 2w 1/4p, drew clear, held safe

ENTRY.NAME: Bonne Chance
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and Levine Bruce N
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 2p 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed ins 3/8, 4-3w upper, kept on

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 4-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, faltered

ENTRY.COMMENT: shied out st, led early, dueled 5p, 3w turn, 4w upper, eased home

ENTRY.COMMENT: checked st, chassed 3-4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, good finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Hudson S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 109. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds, 122 lbs. Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstake in 2023 all owed 2 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, October 14, 2023 with 19 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROTKNEE coaxed from the gate, crossed to the two path to duel with TODAY'S FLAVOR to his inside, raced two to three wide through the turn and began to shake away near the quarter pole, swung four to five wide into upper stretch, drew clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in growing a bit weary late and held safe to the finish. NY TRAFFIC chased five wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, went seven wide into upper stretch, closed well to secure the place honors. THIN WHITE DUKE chased four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick. WIN FOR GOLD tossed his head to the right side as the latch was sprung and hit the off side stall before lunging out of the gate well behind the field conceding eight to nine lengths to the front, chased four then three wide detached at the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, went eight wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying with good courage and was herded slightly out by NY TRAFFIC, offered up a mild kick to be along for the last major share. OCEAN'S RESERVE broke out at the start taking over the lane left vacant by the aforementioned foe, chased just off the inside and then along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide for home, offered up a bid but was outfinished. AMUNDSON three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, tired. TODAY'S FLAVOR coaxed from the gate, dueled inside of ROTKNEE from soon after the start, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, got shaken off and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, then tired in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Today's Flavor
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled inside, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean's Reserve
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, coaxed ins 3/8, 3w upper, bid, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Win for Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Ten Strike Racing Four Corners Racing Broadview Stables and Cory Moelis Racing L
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head, hit gate st, chased 4-3w, 8w upper, good courage

ENTRY.NAME: Amundson
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC and Five Horsemen Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Thin White Duke
ENTRY.OWNER: Gleaves Philip A Crist Steven deRegt Ken and Hilliard Bryan
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ny Traffic
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John Cash is King LLC LC Racing LLC Braverman Paul and Team Hanley
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5w, coaxed near 1/4, 7w upper, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Rotknee
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 2p, 2-3w turn, 4-5w upper, drew clear, safe

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Empire Classic S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 10 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 103. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $250 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,250 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,250 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $1,250 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entrie s. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds 122 lbs. Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstakes at a m ile or over in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake in 2023 or two races at a mile or over other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, October 14, 20
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRAIGHT ARROW got brushed at the start by CICCIOBELLO due to pressure from UN OJO breaking outwards, raced forwardly placed four then three wide through the first turn before chasing three to four wide down the backstretch, continued four wide through the far turn given a notch to work and placed to light coaxing five-sixteenths from home, took over command narrowly swinging five wide into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole and was under a light drive inside the final sixteenth to prevail kept to task. SHERIFF BIANCO three wide through the opening bend, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch and through the far turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, tipped six to seven wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to secure the place honors over his barn mate as they closed belatedly in tandem to the finish. UN OJO broke out at the start bumping CICCIOBELLO into STRAIGHT ARROW, raced three wide through the first turn, chased four then five wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled seven to eight wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to close in on the winner in concert with the aforementioned foe inside the final sixteenth while well clear for the show honors. CICCIOBELLO got bumped at the start by UN OJO and in turn brushed STRAIGHT ARROW, raced three then two wide forwardly placed through the first turn and engaged LOBSTA in head to head combat midway on that bend, traded the front three then two wide down the backstretch and into the far turn, shook away from his main pace rival safely with seven-sixteenths to go and was confronted by the top with five-sixteenths remaining, yielded command and swung four to five wide at the top of the stretch, then weakened in the final furlong. DRAKE'S PASSAGE just off the inside through the first turn, chased three wide down the backstretch and then four wide through the far turn getting placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch and made no late headway. OLYMPIC DREAMS hustled from the gate, chased two then three wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the drive. BARESE coaxed from the start, chased along the inside and then just off the inside coming under encouragement with five-sixteenths remaining, angled four wide into upper stretch and weakened. LOBSTA dueled from the two path getting shaken off with seven-sixteenths to go, came under urging at the three-eighths, faded and swung three wide at the head of the stretch, then faltered to the finish. CURLIN'S WISDOM away with the field, quickly grew detached at the tail of the field when sluggish early along the inside through the first turn, chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the far turn, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and trailed throughout while eased home to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Wisdom
ENTRY.COMMENT: sluggish early, chased 3-4w, 6-7w upper, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Lobsta
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2p, shaken off 7/16, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Olympic Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Barese
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased inside, coaxed 2p 5/16, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Drake's Passage
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p 1st turn, chased 3-4w, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff Bianco
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, chased 4-5w, coaxed 3/8, 6-7w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Un Ojo
ENTRY.OWNER: Cypress Creek Equine and Whispering Oaks Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 3w 1st turn, chased 4-5w, 7-8w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Cicciobello
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, dueled 3-2w, shook away 7/16, yielded 4-5w uppr, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Straight Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, 4-3w 1st turn, chased 3-4w, up 5w uppr, edged clear
